title: Intentionally feeding so they can stay in silver or forcing someone to dodge.
body:
http://i.imgur.com/r7Le5ZF.png

Why is there no way to report this in client? Does Riot even read these post?

replies.body:
Hi Taliesin,

The Boards are not the right place to report things like this
Also, can you please remove the name as there is a "[no naming and shaming policy](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BjArMH2B-boards-universal-rules)" on the boards.

For cases like this, please send in a [support ticket to Riot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), detailing what happened as well as any evidence you may have (screenshots). Please keep in mind that player support is busy and it may take a lil while for them to get back to you (almost always reply within a week). During this time do not lodge multiple tickets or continue adding information to your existing ticket, as it may send your enquiry to the back of the queue.

In the future, be sure to use the end-game reporting screen as consistent reports through this feature is the best way to get a player punished. 

Due to privacy reasons Riot can't respond to your ticket with details about if a punishment was handed out or not.
I tried putting it into a support ticket but this does not match any of the choices given on the page you linked.
Just put it in "I have a question about League of Legends" then I think the option is General something.
Why don't they just dodge themselves? I know people that don't want to climb who just dodge their promos in champ select.
because they care about no one but themselves.

They probably don't want to incur time penalties for dodging, which reach 30 minutes on the second instance. I mean, can you imagine dodging a bunch of games with a 30 minute penalty each time? Mind you, it might not be much of a difference in time compared to feeding every game, but I wouldn't know honestly.

You'll have to submit a support ticket, this post will be removed because of Riots naming policy "Please don't name names. If you see or hear about another person breaking the rules, send us a ticket directly so we can investigate and take action if necessary." I have never encountered this though.
Now this is a first for me lol
